intro: Clinopodium discolor, commonly known as white dead-nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and have a pale underside. Its small, pale blue to white flowers are arranged in whorls along the stem, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Clinopodium discolor is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
